ghostpdf 0.0.1.0
  • Reference

    PDF Combine

    pdf_merge.Rd

    Combine multiple pdf's in one unique file

    Usage

    pdf_merge(
  pdf_files_to_paste = list.files(pattern = "\\.pdf"),
  output_file = "output.pdf",
  auto_rotate_pages = c("None", "All", "PageByPage"),
  pdf_settings = c("default", "ebook", "screen", "printer", "prepress"),
  gs_path = NULL,
  quiet = TRUE,
  cleanup = FALSE,
  preserve_annotations = TRUE,
  detect_duplicate_images = FALSE,
  fast_web_view = FALSE,
  max_inline_image_size = NULL,
  additional_flags = c("-dAutoFilterColorImages=false", "-dAutoFilterGrayImages=false",
    "-dColorImageFilter=/FlateEncode", "-dGrayImageFilter=/FlateEncode",
    "-dDownsampleMonoImages=false", "-dDownsampleGrayImages=false")
)

    Arguments

    pdf_files_to_paste

    vector with pdf files to combine in one unique pdf or a character indicating which pdf's (such as *.pdf)

    output_file

    name of the output pdf that combines all pdfs

    auto_rotate_pages

    automatically rotate pages when pasting (default = "None")

    pdf_settings

    Presets the "distiller parameters" to one of four predefined settings: "eBook" "ebook", "Screen Optimized" "screen", "Print Optimized" "printer", "Prepress Optimized" "prepress" or "default"

    gs_path

    path to Ghostscript installation

    quiet

    Don't output messages

    cleanup

    Delete the files after merge? Default is F

    preserve_annotations

    boolean flag to try and preserve annotations in the pdfs (default TRUE)

    detect_duplicate_images

    boolean that attempts to detect the same image file and keep only one version of the image to reduce pdf size.

    fast_web_view

    boolean that reorders the output PDF file to conform to the Adobe 'linearised' PDF specification

    max_inline_image_size

    Specifies the maximum size of an inline image, in bytes. For images larger than this size, pdfwrite will create an XObject instead of embedding the image into the context stream. The default value is 4000. Note that redundant inline images must be embedded each time they occur in the document, while multiple references can be made to a single XObject image. Therefore it may be advantageous to set a small or zero value if the source document is expected to contain multiple identical images, reducing the size of the generated PDF.

    additional_flags

    Additional string of bash flags to pass to ghostscript

    Details

    Needs Ghostscript installation to work

    Examples

    for (i in 1:9){
  pdf(paste0("Example",i,".pdf"), width = 6, height = 4)
  plot(rnorm(10), rnorm(10), main = paste("Example",i,".pdf"))
  dev.off()
}

#Combine the pdf's
pdf_merge(list.files(pattern = "Example.*\\.pdf"), output_file = "merge_1.pdf",
cleanup = TRUE)
#> NULL
file.remove("merge_1.pdf")
#> [1] TRUE
